resources.string: Allows the extractor to resize the image down to 4MB, the limit for the free version of Azure Document Intelligence.\n Only disable this if you are using the pro version.
Azure Form Recognizer API Key.\n The key connected to the instance of the Document Intelligence resource you created.
The key you created in the OpenAI platform.
The endpoint associated with the Document Intelligence resource you created.

This extractor uses external keys to keep costs minimal and be transparent. 
 Please head to the linked site to create the keys used for the extraction. 
We use OpenAI for text extraction and Azure for table extraction. 
 You can leave the Azure key empty if you are not using tables, but the OpenAI key is required. 
 
 Costs will be approximated by us, but you can check the costs in the respective platforms. 
 
 We try to keep the costs minimal and the extraction as accurate as possible, and we are committed to keeping it non-profit and the costs transparent.
Are you sure you want to delete this extraction?
This is the default value for the field. If the extraction does not find anything or something goes wrong, this will be the value returned. \n \n Default values are not available for lists.
This is the title of the table. It is totally irrelevant for the extraction and is just for your own reference. \n \n It will be invented by the LLM if left empty.

This is the description of the table. It will be appended to the LLM message. \n \n Use it if there is important context for the information, or to specify what to ignore or look for. However, it is very optional.
If you want to extract all the information we can find, choose this option. \n \n This does not return column and row names and can be inaccurate.
The maximum number of rows and columns for the table is 15. \n \n Please use multiple tables if needed.
If the field is required, setting this to false could mean the field will not be present in the extraction. \n \nIf true, it will always be present, but please select a default value.
This is the default value for the field.

The LLM will try to interpret the instruction given and return a more flexible response. This is recommended if you want some processed information from the text instead of extracted information that is directly in the text.
If the value is a list of the type submitted. \n This will return multiple values.
Specify the type of data expected for this field (e.g., \'text\', \'number\', \'date\'). \n This will affect the type of the extracted data.\n The default value must be set accordingly.
This is the description of the field. This will also be used to extract the data, but you don\'t need to be super specific. \n This field can be left empty if the title is descriptive enough.

This is the title of the field.
 The most important part of the field. 
 This will be used to extract the data of the corresponding field. 
 Leaving this empty will probably return the default.

"These are the keywords that the LLM will look for in the text to extract the table. \n Preferably, you should insert words that will be in this specific table and not the other ones, as to distinguish between them."
Add an extra image to the extraction. These are separate from the extraction and are only for your convenience. \nUse these for logos or other images that you want attached to the extraction.
An error occurred while capturing the photo.

Select the language to use for the extraction. It should be the same as the language used in the document.
 
 You can also let the system detect the language automatically. 
 
 Extraction does not currently support other languages by default, but you could request support in the descriptions.
Select the format to export the extraction. \n The created file will be of the format selected
Select the model to use for the extraction. \n A better model will return better results but it costs more, smart mix uses both
Azure OCR is better than the default one and will return better results, but it implies higher costs as every page will be scanned instead of just the ones with tables.
Choose a template to start extracting.
You cannot extract without keys. Please enter your OpenAI keys in the settings.
You cannot use Azure OCR without Azure keys.
Your template contains a table. Azure is required for table extraction.
Please enter your Azure keys in the settings.
Errors occurred while fetching the extraction.
" Keys connected to your Azure Document Intelligence resource, which you can create in the Azure portal at the link: "
"Keys you created on the OpenAI platform,which you can find at the link: "
This is the title of the template.\n This is irrelevant for the extraction, just for your own reference.
Are you sure you want to delete this template?
No app found to open the file
Are you sure you want to delete this image?
No app found to open the file, downloading instead
Are you sure you want to delete this %1$s?
This is the description of the template. This will be used for the extraction but it is highly optional and can be left empty.\n Use it if you need to pass more context

You can create your own templates or use the sample templates to extract data from images and pdfs. 
 Click on the camera icon to take a photo of or select your document, then choose the desired template,your options, and start the extraction! 
 You can then open, download or send a file containing the extracted values and use them however you want. 
 But one thing before all of this: 
 We are transparent about AI usage costs and our app must use external keys to operate, please head to the settings to insert your own OpenAI key to use for the extraction
Here you can manage your extractions, change whatever you like, and manage the extracted files
Parsing went bad, please put this in a formattable state(anything with / works)\n

Define both rows and columns for precise extraction from specific cells in your table. 

 Delete all columns to extract all data found from the specified rows, regardless of the names of the column they are in. 
 Delete all rows to extract all data from the specified columns, regardless of the names of the row they are in. 

 Delete both or toggle "Everything you find" to extract all table data we can find.

 In essence, specifying rows and columns will extract only what is asked, is more reliable and will return less data, while not specifying will return all that is found of what is left unspecified (rows or column).
Check your OpenAI API key on the openai platform and reinsert it
An error occurred with Azure, check your key and endpoint
Tag failed because of weird characters or the input being too long
Tag failed because of weird characters, this will be fixed in the next update
Call rate limit exceeded, azure was not able to scan all images
limit reached on Azure pricing tier, please upgrade your pricing tier or wait for new credits
Connection error, please check your connection
No internet connection, please check your connection
No text was found in the image

Welcome to the settings screen

The first thing you need to do is to insert your own OpenAI key to use for the extractions. 
Please head to the OpenAI platform by clicking on the blue undescored text to create your own key.
Remember to also insert your billing information as the extractor requires at least a tier 1 account. 
After you have inserted your key, you can also insert your Azure API key and endpoint in the same way to access table extraction. 
For more information on the keys, click on the information icons
you have exceeded your current quota, please check that you added billing information to your OpenAI account and that you have not reached your tier limits on requests per day
you have exceeded your current quota
you do not have access to GPT 4,please check that you added billing information to your OpenAI account
you do not have access to GPT 4
Request was too large and gpt was not able to process it
